alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:31AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Custer County through 115 AM CDT... At 1230 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Litchfield, or 27 miles southeast of Broken Bow, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Block Hill Basin and Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road. This includes Highway 183 between mile markers 73 and 81. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
